721631f-a.text:
Market Street, east side, north from Madison, to and including Henry Streets. The Manhattan Bridge is seen in the background.
September 9, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
721631f-a.folder: Market Street & Madison Street, Manhattan, NY

721536f-a.text:
Madison Street, north side, west from and including Market, to, but
not including Catherine Streets.
March 9, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
721536f-a.folder: Madison Street & Market Street, Manhattan, NY

721537f-c.text:
(1)
Madison Street, west from and including Market Street, as seen from the Manhattan Bridge and showing a general view of the downtown business district, with the Municipal Building on the right.
June 8, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(W) he same, from a different angle.
July 9, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, but showing a wider view of the skyline of lower New
York.
September 24, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

721540f-a.text:
134 Madison Street, south side, between Market and Pike Streets, showing a garage for the Department of Sanitation under construction by the W.P.A. This, a northward view from the interior of the plot shows the
rears of buildings numbered 148 to 154 Madison Street.
August 12, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
721540f-a.folder: Madison Street & Market Street, Manhattan, NY

721541f-a.text:
134 Madison Street, south side, between Market and Pike Streets, showing W.P.A. employees excavating for a new garage. The rear and side views shown, are of No. 14S, a 3-story structure and its rear component.
May 14, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
721541f-a.folder: Madison Street & Market Street, Manhattan, NY

721542f-a.text:
134 Madison Street, south side, between Market and Pike Streets, showing W.P.A. employees constructing a garage under the Manhattan Bridge.
September 3, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
721542f-a.folder: Madison Street & Market Street, Manhattan, NY
